member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class used to create and verify signatures.
member.param: The that will be used for cryptographic operations.

If this is required to create signatures then set this to true.
Creating signatures requires that the has access to a private key. Verifying signatures (the default), does not require access to the private key.
member.exception: willCreateSignatures is true and .KeySize is less than the size corresponding to the given algorithm in .
.KeySize is less than the size corresponding to the algorithm in . Note: this is always checked.

member.name: T:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Base64UrlEncoder
member.summary: Encodes and Decodes strings as Base64Url encoding.

member.name: M:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Base64UrlEncoder.Encode(System.String)
member.summary: The following functions perform base64url encoding which differs from regular base64 encoding as follows * padding is skipped so the pad character '=' doesn't have to be percent encoded * the 62nd and 63rd regular base64 encoding characters ('+' and '/') are replace with ('-' and '_') The changes make the encoding alphabet file and URL safe.
member.returns: Base64Url encoding of the UTF8 bytes.

member.name: M:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Base64UrlEncoder.Encode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a subset of an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64-url digits. Parameters specify the subset as an offset in the input array, and the number of elements in the array to convert.
member.param: The number of elements of inArray to convert.
member.returns: The string representation in base 64 url encodingof length elements of inArray, starting at position offset.
member.exception: offset or length is negative OR offset plus length is greater than the length of inArray.

member.name: M:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Base64UrlEncoder.Encode(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a subset of an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64-url digits. Parameters specify the subset as an offset in the input array, and the number of elements in the array to convert.
member.returns: The string representation in base 64 url encodingof length elements of inArray, starting at position offset.
member.exception: offset or length is negative OR offset plus length is greater than the length of inArray.

member.name: M:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Base64UrlEncoder.DecodeBytes(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified string, which encodes binary data as base-64-url digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.
member.returns: UTF8 bytes.

member.name: M:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Base64UrlEncoder.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the string from Base64UrlEncoded to UTF8.
member.returns: UTF8 string.

member.name: T:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.DiagnosticUtility
member.summary: Provides common code for services to use in generating diagnostics and taking actions.

member.name: M:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.DiagnosticUtility.IsFatal(System.Exception)
member.summary: Returns true if the provided exception matches any of a list of hard system faults that should be allowed through to outer exception handlers.

remarks.para: Typically this method is used when there is a need to catch all exceptions, but to ensure that .NET runtime and execution engine exceptions are not absorbed by the catch block. Use of this method also avoids FxCop warnings about not using general catch blocks.

Please note that use of this method is expensive because of the amount of reflection it performs. If you can refactor your code to catch more specific exceptions than Exception to avoid using this method, you should.

member.returns: true if the exception should NOT be trapped

member.summary:
Creates a using:
'NameClaimType': If NameClaimTypeRetriever is set, call delegate, else call NameClaimType. If the result is a null or empty string, use .
'RoleClaimType': If RoleClaimTypeRetriever is set, call delegate, else call RoleClaimType. If the result is a null or empty string, use .
member.returns: A with Authentication, NameClaimType and RoleClaimType set.

member.summary: Gets or sets an used for signature validation.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.IssuerValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to validate the issuer of the token.
member.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to validate the 'issuer' of the token, instead of normal processing. If is false, this delegate will not be called.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.LifetimeValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to validate the lifetime of the token
member.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to validate the lifetime of the token, instead of normal processing. If is false, this delegate will not be called.

member.summary: Gets or sets a that defines the .

remarks.para: Each where == will be checked for a match against the 'string' passed to .

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.NameClaimTypeRetriever
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be called to obtain the NameClaimType to use when creating a ClaimsIdentity after validating a token.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.RequireExpirationTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether tokens must have an 'expiration' value.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.RequireSignedTokens
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a can be considered valid if not signed.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.RoleClaimTypeRetriever
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be called to obtain the RoleClaimType to use when creating a ClaimsIdentity after validating a token.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.SaveSigninToken
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the original token should be saved after the security token is validated.
member.remarks: The runtime will consult this value and save the orginal token that was validated.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.SignatureValidator
member.summary: Gets or sets a delegate that will be used to validate the signature of the token.
member.remarks: If set, this delegate will be called to signature of the token, instead of normal processing. If is false, this delegate will not be called.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.TokenReplayCache
member.summary: Gets or set the that store tokens that can be checked to help detect token replay.
member.remarks: If set, then tokens must have an expriation time or the runtime will fault.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateActor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if an actor token is detected, whether it should be validated.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateAudience
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the audience will be validated during token validation.
member.remarks: Validation of the audience, mitigates forwarding attacks. For example, a site that receives a token, could not replay it to another side. A forwarded token would contain the audience of the original site.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean to control if the lifetime will be validated during token validation.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateIssuerSigningKey
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean that controls if validation of the that signed the securityToken is called.
member.remarks: It is possible for tokens to contain the public key needed to check the signature. For example, X509Data can be hydrated into an X509Certificate, which can be used to validate the signature. In these cases it is important to validate the SigningKey that was used to validate the signature.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidateSignature
member.summary: Gets or sets the boolean to control if the signature of the token will be validated during token validation.
member.remarks: By default all tokens should have the signature validated before preforming any work associated with the token.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidAudience
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that represents a valid audience that will be used to check against the token's audience.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidAudiences
member.summary: Gets or sets the that contains valid audiences that will be used to check against the token's audience.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidIssuer
member.summary: Gets or sets a that represents a valid issuer that will be used to check against the token's issuer.

member.name: P:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.TokenValidationParameters.ValidIssuers
member.summary: Gets or sets the that contains valid issuers that will be used to check against the token's issuer.
